intro: Prismatomeris sessiliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved glasswort, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline habitats. Its small, clustered flowers are usually green or reddish in color. Prismatomeris sessiliflora plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various organisms in its native range.
